title: Principles of Biochemistry
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of biochemistry. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.

title: Fundamentals of Physiology
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in physiology. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.

title: Evolution
description: Comprehensive study of evolution with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.

title: Applied Bioinformatics
description: Interdisciplinary approach to bioinformatics combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.

title: Evolution
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in evolution. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.

title: Advanced Microbiology
description: Interdisciplinary approach to microbiology combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.

title: Advanced Physiology
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in physiology. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.

title: Graduate Biotechnology
description: Rigorous treatment of biotechnology theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.
prerequisites: BIOC 300 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Advanced Microbiology
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in microbiology. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.
prerequisites: BIOC 323 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Advanced Genetics
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in genetics. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.
prerequisites: BIOC 340 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Special Topics in Molecular Biology
description: In-depth analysis of molecular biology principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
prerequisites: BIOC 387 and senior standing or graduate status
